text:
Hey, guys! We're at
Star Wars Galaxy's Edge

at Disneyland Park,
and we just rode

Millennium Falcon:
Smuggler's Run.

- Yeah!
- You can either be a pilot,
a gunner, or an engineer.

And we thought
it would be kind of cool

to play a little game
with real life stuff.
Are you a pilot, a gunner,

or an engineer
when you order pizza?

Right.
So, for me, I'm a gunner.

I make a decision,
I take aim at the menu,

and I'm like, "I want some
pineapple on my pizza."

But then I change my mind
and I recalibrate,

- and I pop over to sausage.
- So, an engineer.

I'm an engineer
with my pizza picking.

- Absolutely.
- Thank you.

You're welcome.
I'm more of a pilot.
I'm like, "Listen, folks.

This is what
we're going to have.
There's no negotiating.

I'll order a few different
options for you,

and then you can choose,
but I'll be the pilot."

That would be very helpful
to have at the table.

How about, like,
waking up in the morning?

I-- in the morning,
I'm for sure a gunner.

I'm just, like,
we will figure it out
when that time of day comes.

I wake up.
I just jump out of bed.

I don't know what
I'm going to wear.

But you know what?
Top of the stack.

And then I run out,
grab a quick bar,

and then I'm in my car
off to work. What about you?

When I wake up,
I'm more of an engineer.

I plan what my outfit's
going to be in the morning.

I have my toothbrush set
before I even brush my hair.

And so then when
I brush my hair, bam!
I'm on to my toothbrush.

I have everything
scheduled out.

That's nice.
Can't relate, but nice.

What about when you pick a song
in the car? What are you?
I'm definitely a gunner

because I do my scrolling
on my library of music,

and then I just have a feeling.
I'm like, "That's the one."

So I'm kind of like a gunner
with Force capabilities.

I'm like, "That's the song
that fits this right now."

- How about you?
- Okay, okay.

- I'm a pilot.
- Pilot?

Yeah, for sure.
Because I'm like,

"You know what?
I've got this.

I know what we need right now.
I know the energy.

I can feel the car.
If people are down,

we got to bring in something
a little more upbeat.

If we're not--
if it's the end of the day

and we're driving home
after being at the park today?

I'm just going to have us
cruise home to something nice--

- nice and calming.
- You know, playing this game,

I think I've learned
a lot about you.

- Yeah, same.
- Yeah, I--

I don't feel like
I needed to know all of it.

- Ooh.
- Probably didn't want

- to know all of it.
- But I feel like you do.
I think it's helpful.

Now we know who should be
playing the music in the car

if we're road-tripping
or something.

- Yeah, that's true.
- You know?

- So true.
- Our own Millennium Falcon.
May the Force be with you.
And also with you.
